author: Alexandra Wolfe
title: Mummies Come to Life in Ohio
text:
In recent years, Ohio’s Toledo Museum of Art has only rarely put its three Egyptian mummies on display. The museum was worried about preserving them but also about the ethics of showing human remains. Still, visitors kept asking, “Where are the mummies?” They’re now appearing—one partially unwrapped—with other related artifacts in “The Mummies: From Egypt to Toledo,” running from Feb. 3 to May 6. The exhibit invites people to ponder what respect for the ancient dead requires. “Mummies are real humans who never intended to be in Toledo, Ohio,” says co-curator Adam Levine.
...
